Greetings of the day and Happy Diwali!

To promote API Literacy and API-First Principles amongst BITS students,

cost!* It shall
give an opportunity to all BITSians to learn API-based programming, which
is currently being offered to leading institutions globally!

registered students will get a *certificate of completion* and *free access=

shall be shared with the registered students.

For registrations and course details please visit
https://www.bits-postman-lab.in. Hurry! Limited seats available!

subject: PS-I 2021 Chronicles
body:
Dear All,
Greetings from Practice School Division.

Practice School-I (PS-I) is an integral part of the curriculum of BITS
Pilani, offered to First Degree students at the end of their second year of
the degree programme, during the summer. PS-I is an exposure-oriented
course of an eight-week duration, the goal of which is to provide students
an opportunity to observe how the workplace functions and help them apply
the knowledge gained during their studies in the workplace. PS-I helps
students nurture their professional, cognitive, and technical skills and
host organizations by the enthusiastic participation and contribution of
students to their ongoing work at their working premises.  PS-I is
monitored and evaluated by a resident faculty, who conducts the program, in
consultation with the host organization coordinator.  PS-I faculty is ably
supported by student co-instructors and faculty co-instructors in
operational and technical aspects, respectively.

Keeping the largest interest of wider knowledge dissemination, PSD is happy
to bring forth the second edition of the PS-I Chronicles featuring over
1800 articles from PS-I students sharing their experiences during summer
2021. The basic premise behind the release of PS-I Chronicles is to
document the PS-I learning experience of students keeping the below
objectives in view.

1. To provide more information on the learning experiences by immediate
senior students and PS-I faculty about stations, thereby enlightening the
student community's learning opportunity.
2. To provide the faculty with enhanced information about the type and
nature of work carried out at the organization.
3. To transform the knowledge gained at the organization into classroom
teaching and identify the scope of deepening the collaborations with the
organization.

The articles have been classified into five categories based on the
industry domain.
Chronicle 1: Information Technology
Chronicle 2: Electronics
Chronicle 3: Chemical, Mechanical, Cement, Textile, Steel, and
Infrastructure
Chronicle 4: Health Care and others
Chronicle 5: Finance and Management

PSD hopes that these PS-I chronicles will help every reader acknowledge the
type of work done by students in PS-I and provide the necessary feedback
path to bridge the industry-academia gap.

The chronicles are a must-read for prospective PS-I Students as this will
help understand the work that is happening at various PS I Stations.  It
will also help the student to identify his/her interest and hence enhance
the scope of making an informed choice while filling the preference forms
for PS-I.

The third edition of the PS-I chronicles is available at the following link:
https://www.bits-pilani.ac.in/university/practiceschool/PSIChronicles2021

Thank you
Prof. Gaikwad Anil Bhanudas
Associate Dean, PSD, Pilani campus

I am reaching out to you regarding Applied Science internship opportunities
in the domain of Machine Learning (ML) at Amazon.



Through the 2022 internship program, Amazon is looking for interns who are
deeply passionate about machine learning, who aspire to build new customer
experience leveraging state-of-the-art techniques in various fields of
natural language processing, speech recognition, computer vision, and
machine learning and/or data science in general. As interns, students will
get an opportunity to dive deep into hard technical problems and come up
with novel solutions that can improve the customer experience in a
meaningful way. They will work on complex real-world e-commerce problems in
a team of highly skilled ML scientists. Interns will be expected to work
with large-scale data, formulate scientific hypothesis to help solve
customer pain-points, experiment to validate their ideas, and contribute to
the overall impact of the solution.





*Role: *Applied Scientist Intern

*Locations: *Bangalore, Hyderabad, Chennai

*Internship Duration & Timeline:* *Internship Timeline: *The duration of
the internship is 5-6 months (minimum duration is 5 months) and the
internship can begin during any month starting January 2022 based on
availability of selected interns.

*Mode of Internship: *Virtual/in office based on the return to office
guideline at Amazon

*Stipend:* INR 90,000 per month for Bachelors, Integrated Masters, Masters
and INR 120,000 for PhDs

Students pursuing Bachelor=E2=80=99s, Integrated Master=E2=80=99s, Master=

pre-placement offer (PPO) based on their performance during internship.

The Indian IT sector as a whole has been at such a fast pace industry in its growth and development. However, in terms of employment, job demands, and influential opportunities, some cities have been the hub for job aspirants. Some of the cities where the heart of the IT industry lies are –

  • Bengaluru, Karnataka (known as the silicon valley of India)
  • Pune, Maharashtra
  • Hyderabad
  • Gurgaon, Haryana
  • New Delhi
  • Chennai, Tamil Nadu
  • Mumbai, Maharashtra
  • Noida, Uttar Pradesh

These cities have, with time, broadened the horizon of the tech industry by opening up many interesting and latest job positions for the tech aspirants. There are many factors that affect one job profile’s salary like experience, job roles, location, employer, skillset. Below is given the average base salary for the highest paid jobs in India based on experience –

Software Development Engineer
A software development engineer is a technical professional who is responsible for creating applications and software programs that can be run on different platforms and operating systems. There is a great demand for this job profile amongst many big tech giants like TCS, Udemy, Amazon, etc.

Key Highlights of the Job Role

  • Valued job position in the tech industry.
  • One of the highest paying jobs.
  • The opportunity for great learning.
  • Work with some great companies in the industry.

 

Know More

 

Blockchain Engineer
Blockchain is the leading technology for the Banking and Finance Sector. And a professional expert to manage and handle the entire infrastructure of the blockchain technology, employers hire a blockchain engineer.

It is among the high-salary jobs in India because of the rising demand for Bitcoin and Etherium. Blockchain technologies have opened up infinite possibilities for aspirants as well as employers.

Key Highlights of the Job Role

  • High demand but Limited Workforce.
  • Working on the latest technology.
  • Great tech giants are hiring Blockchain Engineers.
  • Leading job position.

Data Scientist
Data Scientist is a job position that requires expertise in scientific analyzing and interpreting of Big Data. Big Data is a large set of information/ data that cannot be analyzed with the traditional techniques of data processing. This is where comes the Data Scientist.

Key Highlights of the Job Role

  • High Demand in every industry.
  • According to the reports, the base salary is 36% higher than other job’s average income.
  • Higher growth and learning rate.
  • The scope of the job role is flourishing.

Cloud Architect
A cloud Architect is responsible for the design, architect, implementation, and maintenance of the cloud computing components. Cloud computing is broad network access that allows delivery for services like storage, networking, database, servers, analytics over the internet without any human interaction.

Key Highlights of the Job Role

  • In-demand skills or roles by employers.
  • Scale up your career growth and learning.
  • One of the Trendiest job in IT Industry.
  • An excellent option for freshers.

The Visual Computing Group (vcg.seas.harvard.edu

ttp%3A%2F%2Fvcg.seas.harvard.edu%2F>)
in the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS) at Harvard
University is working on applied research projects in deep learning and
computer vision for neuroscience. The group has been publishing regularly
in top computer vision venues like CVPR, ICCV, ECCV etc.
VCG is offering remote Computer Vision and Machine Learning internships and
thesis opportunities for students in their Junior and Senior years (i.e.
have completed their second year).

*About the Role*
The intern students will work closely with CS graduate students and
biomedical collaborators on research projects. Below is a list of ongoing
projects:

   - *Connectomics *(with Jeff Lichtman at Harvard and Ed Boyden at MIT):
   design and deploy deep learning models for 3D neural segmentation. It is
   the next "human genome project".
   - *IVF Research *(with Daniel Needleman at Harvard): design and deploy
   deep learning models for geometry detection and object tracking.
   - *Cancer Research *(with Peter Sorger at Harvard Medical School):
   design and deploy deep learning models for clustering and
   expert-in-the-loop cell type categorization.
   - *Video Understanding*: design deep learning models for video object
   segmentation.

*Benefits*

   - Recommendation letter: Prof. Hanspeter Pfister (Harvard Computer
   Science) or Prof. Donglai Wei (Boston College)
   - Stipend (negotiable): $150/month for undergrads and $450/month for
   graduate students

*Requirements*
The candidate should have a solid background in software engineering.
Experience in the following areas will be a plus:

   - Coursework in machine learning or computer vision
   - Familiar with developing and deploying deep learning models

*Application Process *
Please email *linzudi@g.harvard.edu <linzudi@g.harvard.edu> *your resume
and github repository link. If qualified, zoom interviews will be offered.

We are glad to share with you an internship opportunity at NexStem. Here is
a brief description for the same:


**************************

*About NexStem*

NexStem is a new-age technology company working to enhance human
capabilities by empowering the brain to seamlessly interact with machines
and execute complex tasks with just thoughts. NexStem is building
cutting-edge technologies that will open doors to endless possibilities.
The technology can be used to create mind-enabled wheelchairs, prostheses,
and even communication systems for people suffering from paralysis. It can
also be integrated with Smart Home devices to ensure higher levels of
security. By monitoring the user's EEG data, we can also help improve their
mental health, by relevant feedback based on their emotions, mood, stress
level, and sleeping patterns.

*Role**: Python, Django Developer Intern*


*Role Description:*

1. Take part in our product development from ideation to deployment and
beyond.

2. Develop and maintain scalable backend APIs

3. Developing a high-quality code that caters to the product requirements.

4. Be creative in using tools to deliver the code faster.

5. Take ownership of the product.

6. Setup CI/CD pipelines.



*Expectations:*

1. Strong Proficiency in Django, DRF, Django-Channels.

2. Working knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.

3. Basic knowledge of Cloud Services (Azure) would be a big plus.

3. Hands-on experience in writing modular code with proper routing and
client/server setup.

4. Feel at home working in a test-driven, agile team.

5. A strong problem-solver with an inquisitive and innovative mind



*Role**: Frontend Developer (ReactJS) Intern*

*Role Description:*

1.     Design User Interfaces for our web app.

2.     Take part in our product development from ideation to deployment and
beyond.

3.     Developing high-quality code that caters to the product requirements.

4.     Be creative in using tools to deliver the code faster. Take
ownership of the product.

*Expectations:*

1. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (preferably Typescript)

2. Expertise in ReactJS and state management using Redux.

3. Knowledge in CSS pre-processor like SASS, LESS, and CSS in JS (Styled
components)

4. Minimum expertise in jQuery.

5. Experience with visualization/charting libraries such as D3 and ChartJS.

6. Clear concepts in REST API, WebSocket, MVC Architecture, and

*Qualifications:*

Currently in 2nd, 3rd, and 4th year of study with demonstrated knowledge of

body:
Dear Students

Greetings from The FIRP (Forum of International Relations and Public
Policy), BITS Pilani Goa campus. We would like to thank all of you for an
overwhelming response to our Special Lecture on '*International Careers for
Young Indians*' with the speaker, *Ms. Akshaya Shivkumar* (World Bank,
Washington DC).

We are excited to announce the confirmation of our *Public Policy research
project* in the *PetCare* domain in association with Zibatech Wellness Pvt.
Ltd, a startup by IIT Delhi alumni. Apply Now using the link
https://forms.gle/2dg6n8VMZWHQQSve6

The details of the project are as follows:

During the COVID-19 pandemic, there had been multiple incidents in the
media wherein we observed that there was a huge influx of people who
adopted pets during the lockdown. But the downside to that was the number
of animals being abandoned on streets also increased manifolds.

Seeing and observing these trends, The FIRP (Forum of International
Relations and Public Policy), BITS Pilani Goa (
https://www.facebook.com/ThefirpBITSGoa) in collaboration with an IITD
alumni startup, Zibatech Wellness Pvt. Ltd (
https://www.zibatechs.com/our-initiatives), has launched a program where we
are working on a research project to identify major policy decisions that
may help to stop these incidences of abandonment and are collecting a
database of all the pet owners in India for making a community where we can
help people struggling in taking care of their pets by finding new parents
for their pets within that community.

This is a callout for any interested volunteers who want to help us in this
journey of ours.

All the interns cum volunteers will receive the following incentives:
1. *Co-endorsed Internship Completion Certificate from The FIRP and
Zibatech Wellness Pvt. Ltd.*
2. *Letter of Recommendation and Appreciation* endorsed by alumni from IIT
Delhi and BITS Pilani for top 15 volunteers
3. *A honorarium of rupees 1000 INR and goodies from Zibatech Wellness* for
the top-performing volunteers (depends on your performance)
